definition: to reach a verdict/to conclude a judgment
to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order

sentences.english: I have to finalize this proposal.
sentences.chinese: 我需要把這個提議定案。

sentences.english: This includes confessions of defendants and testimonies of prosecution witnesses, which underpin most criminal convictions in China.
sentences.chinese: 這包括國內常用來定案的被告人證詞和證人口供。

sentences.english: The evidences that could be used to determine a case shall be exclusive.
sentences.chinese: 據以定案的證據必須具有排它性和唯一性。

sentences.english: Sellers on the short list often prepare a best and final offer (BAFO).
sentences.chinese: 買方通常會要求進入決選的供應商準備一份最佳定案。

sentences.english: Any of the above evidence must be verified before it can be used as the basis for deciding cases.
sentences.chinese: 以上證據必須經過查證屬實，才能作爲定案的根據。

definition: to discuss together/to try to reach a common judgment/panel discussion
to judge a case/to render a verdict/verdict
to retract testimony/to withdraw a confession
oral confession (as opposed to 筆供|笔供[bi3 gong4])/statement/deposition
to re-investigate/to investigate and reconsider a judgment
